name: Diwali
short_description: Diwali is the Hindu festival of lights symbolizing the victory of light over darkness.
long_description: Diwali is celebrated by lighting oil lamps, bursting fireworks, performing Lakshmi Puja, and sharing sweets. It marks Lord Rama's return to Ayodhya and represents spiritual illumination and prosperity.
image_query: Diwali India Hindu festival of lights diyas

name: Holi
short_description: Holi is a popular Hindu festival known for vibrant colored powder celebrations.
long_description: Holi marks the arrival of spring and the victory of good over evil. People celebrate by throwing colored powders, dancing, and sharing festive foods like gujiya.

name: Christmas
short_description: Christmas celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ.
long_description: Observed worldwide, Christmas includes traditions like decorating Christmas trees, exchanging gifts, and attending church services. It is both a religious and cultural celebration.

name: Eid al-Fitr
short_description: Eid al-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic month of fasting.
long_description: Muslims celebrate by attending communal prayers, giving charity (Zakat al-Fitr), visiting relatives, and enjoying festive meals.

name: Eid al-Adha
short_description: Eid al-Adha honors the willingness of Ibrahim to sacrifice his son in obedience to God.
long_description: Muslims around the world celebrate by sacrificing livestock, distributing meat to the poor, offering prayers, and visiting family.

name: Chinese New Year
short_description: Chinese New Year marks the beginning of the lunar calendar with fireworks and traditional celebrations.
long_description: Families reunite, exchange red envelopes, enjoy feasts, and watch lion and dragon dances. Each year is associated with a zodiac animal.
image_query: Chinese New Year dragon dance fireworks

name: Songkran
short_description: Songkran is Thailand’s water festival marking the traditional New Year.
long_description: People celebrate by splashing water for purification, visiting temples, and performing acts of respect for elders.

name: Oktoberfest
short_description: Oktoberfest is the world’s largest beer festival held annually in Munich.
long_description: Millions attend to enjoy Bavarian beer, music, traditional clothing, parades, and hearty meals.

name: Hanami
short_description: Hanami celebrates the blooming of cherry blossoms across Japan.
long_description: People gather under sakura trees for picnics, appreciating the beauty and impermanence of nature.

name: Hanukkah
short_description: Hanukkah is a Jewish festival celebrating the rededication of the Second Temple.
long_description: It is observed by lighting the menorah for eight nights, playing dreidel, and eating foods fried in oil.

name: Carnival of Rio de Janeiro
short_description: The Rio Carnival is the world's biggest samba parade and street festival.
long_description: Rio Carnival features samba school parades, street parties called blocos, stunning costumes, and energetic music attracting millions each year.

name: La Tomatina
short_description: La Tomatina is a massive tomato-throwing festival held in Buñol, Spain.
long_description: Participants throw ripe tomatoes at each other in a joyful food-fight tradition that began in 1945 and now attracts visitors worldwide.

name: Bastille Day
short_description: Bastille Day commemorates the storming of the Bastille during the French Revolution.
long_description: Festivities include military parades on the Champs-Élysées, fireworks, concerts, and communal dancing throughout France.

name: Burning Man
short_description: Burning Man is an experimental art and community festival held in the Nevada desert.
long_description: Participants create Black Rock City, showcasing large-scale art, music, and performance while following principles like radical inclusion and self-expression.

name: Gion Matsuri

name: Up Helly Aa
short_description: Up Helly Aa is a fire festival in Scotland celebrating Viking heritage.

name: Cascamorras
short_description: A quirky Spanish festival where people chase a statue and splatter each other with paint.
long_description: In Guadix and Baza, locals run through the streets, chase a devilish figure, and color each other with grease paint in a long tradition of rivalry and fun.

name: Rann Utsav
short_description: A celebration of music, dance, and crafts in the salt desert of Kutch, Gujarat.
long_description: Local artists, folk musicians, and artisans showcase their skills against the stark beauty of the white salt flats at night.

name: Feast of San Fermin
short_description: Famous Spanish festival known for its daily bull runs in Pamplona.
long_description: Murders of bulls running through the streets, traditional music, fireworks, parades, and religious ceremonies define the week-long fiesta.
image_query: San Fermin Pamplona Running of the Bulls Spain

name: Day of the Dead (Bolivia)
short_description: Bolivia’s tribute to deceased loved ones with altars and folk rituals.
long_description: Families decorate graves, build altars with pictures and offerings, and gather for candlelit vigils at cemeteries.
image_query: Bolivia Dia de los Muertos festival

name: Junkanoo
short_description: Bahamas’ street parade with music, dance and flamboyant costumes after Christmas.
long_description: Communities come alive in the early morning with trumpet, cowbells, goatskin drums and dancing during this vibrant festival.

name: Holi Festival of Nepal
short_description: Nepal's celebration of Holi with water and color.
long_description: People gather along rivers and public squares to throw colored powder and splash water, celebrating with songs and sweets.

name: Pushkar Camel Fair
short_description: A grand livestock fair and cultural festival in Pushkar, Rajasthan.
long_description: Offers camel races, folk music, competitions, decorated camels, and a vibrant night market.

name: Semana Gorda
short_description: Bolivian carnival celebration full of dance, music, and color.
long_description: In Santa Cruz, people wear elaborate costumes, dance in the streets, and celebrate before Lent begins.
image_query: Bolivia Carnaval Santa Cruz Semana Gorda

name: Feria de Cali
short_description: A salsa- and music-filled fair in Cali, Colombia.
long_description: Salsa dancers, concerts, parades, and cultural shows mark the week-long festival on the streets of Cali.
image_query: Feria de Cali Colombia salsa festival

name: Setouchi Triennale
short_description: An art festival held across islands in the Seto Inland Sea of Japan.
long_description: Artists install site-specific contemporary artworks on various islands, blending nature and art across remote locations.
image_query: Setouchi Triennale Japan art festival islands

name: Ivrea Carnival
short_description: Italian festival famous for its large orange-throwing battles.
long_description: Hundreds of teams throw oranges at each other in street battles, recreating historical uprisings with color and energy.

name: Up Helly Aa Lerwick
short_description: Shetland’s fire festival in Lerwick commemorating Viking history.
long_description: Torchlit squads march through town, dressed as Vikings, culminating in the burning of a replica longship.
image_query: Up Helly Aa Lerwick Shetland fire festival

name: Bridges of Königsberg Festival
short_description: A cultural festival in Kaliningrad (formerly Königsberg) celebrating its history and architecture.
long_description: Includes music concerts, historical tours, exhibitions, and talks about the city's heritage and its famous bridges.

name: Prague Spring International Music Festival
short_description: A prestigious classical music festival in Prague featuring orchestras and chamber music.
long_description: Held each May, this festival brings together top musicians and ensembles for concerts in historic venues across Prague.
image_query: Prague Spring Music Festival Czech Republic

name: San Fermín Festival
short_description: Pamplona’s iconic celebration featuring bull running and street parties.
long_description: Thousands of people run with bulls in the streets each morning, followed by celebrations, fireworks, and parades.
